disease: Squamous cell carcinoma of skin of right ear and external auricular canal

physical_findings: Irregular cauliflower-like uneven neoplasm with stench and yellowish-white discharge
Swollen and movable lymph nodes in right supraclavicular fossa
Firm, red nodules and sores on skin of the ear with a scaly crust
risk_factors: Chronic infection of the external auditory canal

CT scan: Tumor mass filling right pinna and external auditory canal
Infiltration of right parotid, temporomandibular joint, external auditory canal, and middle ear
Metastasis of right neck lymph node
Destruction of right parotid, mandibular condyle, temporomandibular joint, external auditory canal, and middle ear
Involvement of left pterygoid muscle and temporomandibular joint
Destruction of submandibular gland and lymph, parapharyngeal space, masseter
Right ear mass extending along tragus, antitragus, replacing auricle and filling external auditory canal
Extension to tympanic membrane with thickening and probable atelectasis
Sclerotic ossicles on right with generalized hyperostosis
Diffuse enhancement of mass with ulceration and hemorrhage
Invasion of right lateral pterygoid muscle group and masseter space
Extension into calvarium without intracranial extension
MRI: Large right ear mass extending along tragus, antitragus, replacing auricle and filling external auditory canal
Extension to tympanic membrane with thickening and probable atelectasis
Diffuse enhancement of mass with ulceration and hemorrhage
Invasion of right lateral pterygoid muscle group and masseter space
Extension into calvarium without intracranial extension

required: Histopathological examination showing squamous cell carcinoma
supportive: Clinical presentation (otorrhea, otalgia, hearing loss, bleeding, facial palsy, mass)
Imaging findings (CT, MRI showing tumor extent and metastasis)
